text: The night is cold.
Something moved.
The door was open.
I heard breathing.
The lights flickered once.
Footsteps behind me now.
The mirror showed someone else.
My shadow moved without me.
Shadows move when you blink.
The whispers know your name.
I locked the door, but it opened anyway.
The phone rang, but no one was there.
Something scratched the window from inside.
The reflection smiled before I did.
I woke up, but my body was still sleeping.
The stairs creak when no one walks on them.
There are too many shadows in this room.
The voice in the walls knows my secrets.
I counted the people in the photo. There's one extra.
The knocking comes from inside the closet now.
Every night at 3am, I hear my name whispered backwards.
The children's laughter stopped when I turned around.
I found my diary, but the last entry wasn't written by me.
The old woman waves at me every morning. She died last year.
The corridor echoed with footsteps that were not mine.
I saw myself walk past the window, but I'm still inside.
Something breathes under my bed — I live alone, and I sleep on the floor.
The doll's eyes follow me, and yesterday it was in a different room.
I don't remember having a basement, but I can hear digging down there.
My grandmother called today. We buried her three months ago.
The thing pretending to be my mother almost got the voice right this time.
I keep finding notes in my handwriting, warning me not to fall asleep.
"Don't look behind you," it whispered, "I'm closer than you think, and I've been patient."
The search party found me in the woods — but I never left my house.
They say if you type fast enough, it can't catch you. They were wrong; it's already here.
I felt something brush my shoulder as I typed this. The room is empty — I checked twice.
